Description: Fragment of oval handle from neck join of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine light buff. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 143 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 143.)
Curator's comments: Ink, deleted, '319'. Name Anaxandros. From the same die as, Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, MGR P.16278.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (17)
